title: 25k-Mile 2013 Mercedes-Benz SL63 AMG
description: This 2013 Mercedes-Benz SL63 AMG remained registered with one owner in Illinois until it was acquired by the selling dealer in 2024, and it now has 25k miles. Finished in black over black premium leather upholstery, the car is powered by a twin-turbocharged 5.5-liter V8 paired with a seven-speed automatic transmission. Optioned with the Premium and Driver Assistance packages, the car also has a limited-slip differential, a power-retractable hardtop, a panoramic roof with Magic Sky Control, 19″ AMG five-spoke alloy wheels, Distronic Plus adaptive cruise control, blind-spot monitoring, Lane Keeping Assist, Parktronic, a backup camera, massaging heated and ventilated seats, Airscarf Neck Warmers, a Harman Kardon sound system, and COMAND infotainment with navigation. This R231 is now offered with a window sticker, a VMI report, manufacturer's literature, a Carfax report, and a clean Illinois title.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a 25k-Mile 2013 Mercedes-Benz SL63 AMG at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #168,155.
text: This 2013 Mercedes-Benz SL63 AMG remained registered with one owner in Illinois until it was acquired by the selling dealer in 2024, and it now has 25k miles. Finished in black over black premium leather upholstery, the car is powered by a twin-turbocharged 5.5-liter V8 paired with a seven-speed automatic transmission. Optioned with the Premium and Driver Assistance packages, the car also has a limited-slip differential, a power-retractable hardtop, a panoramic roof with Magic Sky Control, 19″ AMG five-spoke alloy wheels, Distronic Plus adaptive cruise control, blind-spot monitoring, Lane Keeping Assist, Parktronic, a backup camera, massaging heated and ventilated seats, Airscarf Neck Warmers, a Harman Kardon sound system, and COMAND infotainment with navigation. This R231 is now offered with a window sticker, a VMI report, manufacturer’s literature, a Carfax report, and a clean Illinois title. The car is finished in black (040) and features a power-retractable hardtop with a Magic Sly Control panoramic roof panel. Additional details include AMG spoilers and side skirts, front and rear parking sensors, LED taillights, a decklid spoiler, quad exhaust outlets, tinted windows, and bi-xenon headlights with Active Curve Illumination. The Carfax report lists an accident with a parked vehicle in a June 2013 entry that resulted in damage to the left side, though no additional information is provided. The 19″ AMG five-spoke alloy wheels are mounted with 255/35 front and 285/30 rear Continental tires, the rear of which were replaced in 2024. The car rides on an AMG-tuned Active Body Control (ABC) electronically adjustable suspension, and stopping power is provided by AMG-branded calipers over slotted and cross-drilled rotors. The heated and ventilated active multi-contour seats have massaging functions and are upholstered in black premium leather, which is complemented by Black Ash veneer trim. Interior amenities include seat-position memory, Distronic Plus adaptive cruise control, blind-spot monitoring, Lane Keeping Assist, a back-up camera, Keyless-Go, Airscarf neck warmers, a Harman Kardon sound system, dual-zone automatic climate control, illuminated door sills, a wind deflector, and COMAND infotainment with navigation. The leather-wrapped AMG Performance steering wheel frames a 200-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a 6,300-rpm redline as well as gauges for coolant temperature and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 25k miles. The twin-turbocharged 5.5-liter M157 V8 was factory rated at 530 horsepower and 590 lb-ft of torque. Service in preparation for the sale included an oil change and replacing the engine and cabin air filters. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a seven-speed AMG Speedshift MCT automatic transmission and a limited-slip differential. The window sticker lists initial delivery to Mercedes-Benz of Chicago in Chicago, Illinois, as well as factory colors, equipment, options, and a total retail price of $156,455. Manufacturer’s literature and a VMI report are included in the sale. The Carfax report lists the aforementioned accident. You are not connected to real-time updates. Attempting to connect. html:
This 2013 Mercedes-Benz SL63 AMG remained registered with one owner in Illinois until it was acquired by the selling dealer in 2024, and it now has 25k miles. Finished in black over black premium leather upholstery, the car is powered by a twin-turbocharged 5.5-liter V8 paired with a seven-speed automatic transmission. Optioned with the Premium and Driver Assistance packages, the car also has a limited-slip differential, a power-retractable hardtop, a panoramic roof with Magic Sky Control, 19″ AMG five-spoke alloy wheels, Distronic Plus adaptive cruise control, blind-spot monitoring, Lane Keeping Assist, Parktronic, a backup camera, massaging heated and ventilated seats, Airscarf Neck Warmers, a Harman Kardon sound system, and COMAND infotainment with navigation. This R231 is now offered with a window sticker, a VMI report, manufacturer’s literature, a Carfax report, and a clean Illinois title.

The car is finished in black (040) and features a power-retractable hardtop with a Magic Sly Control panoramic roof panel. Additional details include AMG spoilers and side skirts, front and rear parking sensors, LED taillights, a decklid spoiler, quad exhaust outlets, tinted windows, and bi-xenon headlights with Active Curve Illumination. The Carfax report lists an accident with a parked vehicle in a June 2013 entry that resulted in damage to the left side, though no additional information is provided.

The 19″ AMG five-spoke alloy wheels are mounted with 255/35 front and 285/30 rear Continental tires, the rear of which were replaced in 2024. The car rides on an AMG-tuned Active Body Control (ABC) electronically adjustable suspension, and stopping power is provided by AMG-branded calipers over slotted and cross-drilled rotors.

The heated and ventilated active multi-contour seats have massaging functions and are upholstered in black premium leather, which is complemented by Black Ash veneer trim. Interior amenities include seat-position memory, Distronic Plus adaptive cruise control, blind-spot monitoring, Lane Keeping Assist, a back-up camera, Keyless-Go, Airscarf neck warmers, a Harman Kardon sound system, dual-zone automatic climate control, illuminated door sills, a wind deflector, and COMAND infotainment with navigation.

The leather-wrapped AMG Performance steering wheel frames a 200-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a 6,300-rpm redline as well as gauges for coolant temperature and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 25k miles.

The twin-turbocharged 5.5-liter M157 V8 was factory rated at 530 horsepower and 590 lb-ft of torque. Service in preparation for the sale included an oil change and replacing the engine and cabin air filters.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a seven-speed AMG Speedshift MCT automatic transmission and a limited-slip differential.

The window sticker lists initial delivery to Mercedes-Benz of Chicago in Chicago, Illinois, as well as factory colors, equipment, options, and a total retail price of $156,455. Manufacturer’s literature and a VMI report are included in the sale.

The Carfax report lists the aforementioned accident.
